name: digdugz
text: I bet his wig smells really bad.

name: dj_insomniac
text: I'm surprised that nobody has commented on the disturbingly evocative sounds of the old man... they almost make me want to vomit merely by reading them.

name: aargh
text: ... splat. splat splat. splat. SPLAT. Pure genius.

name: griffypoo
text: I like that there's a sword beside him, as if he had to stop in the middle of the duel he was having so many years ago and immediately start vomiting into a nearby bucket.  For eternity.

name: dusty
text: This isn't as eclectic as it may mean to be, when you're vomiting repeatedly it always seems like its going to go on forever, you feel like an old man, and as you stare at the ground a little voice tells you that you aren't going to be ok.

name: mikekitchell
text: this is hell of my favorite achewood strip

name: wehavemagnums
text: A comment left by wehavemagnums was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, ButterMoths, riotdejaneiro, Thorfinn, gothfae, Ariamaki, odei, unalone, rajib, luckypyjamas, lk, anewcede, Fcannon, suprememongoose, nutmeg, clembot, HellaEdgar)

name: pohlhoud
text:
That strip is great, dude. Retract.

Retract.

name: wehavemagnums
text: A comment left by wehavemagnums was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, TonyHighwind, unalone, RedGuy, nutmeg, cailetshadow, trawser)

name: gethen
text: it doesn't need to be the objective best to be his favorite.  he just likes what he likes is all

name: tommycrashwreck
text:
Top 10 Reasons I Don't Like to Revisit This Strip:

1. This is what the ground actually says to me, everywhere, all the time.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
everytime i get on a plane, i hear these words. i swear somebody just whispered them into my ear.

but i turn around and it's just the flight attendant who's been doing her job for way too long, the light smile wrinkles as proof.

name: saint
text:
I'd stay inside at all times...
...and I probably wouldn't revisit this strip either.

So thank the fucking gods I'm not you.

name: snowman
text: chubbied so hard for only saying one reason

name: quinlaenar
text: Oh sweet buttery CHRIST your avatar made that terrifying.

name: aamzed
text: It is excellent.

name: jamers
text: I wonder what the man plans to do with the sword when he finishes vomiting at the end of eternity?

name: tbtabby
text: What else? Stick it down his throat and begin vomiting anew.

name: spectre
text: He will let Death hold it and practice for a few minutes before she shuts down the Universe.

name: achilleselbow
text: I think the sword goes with the wig to show just how old the man is. Like it's not a historical costume or anything, he's actually so old that he comes from a time when people wore swords and wigs.

name: johnnyrocker
text: Agreed. First prize!

name: djwhiterabbit
text: at least he's got a Bucket.

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sharksarecoming, cailetshadow, magnificentpoof, HollyBones)

name: hipjiverobot
text: Ain't no one gonna steal that bucket.

name: spectre
text: But one day the old man will KICK the bucket, and when he does the tide of vomit will flood out and cover the Earth and it will be the End of Times.

name: jhunter
text:
this is perhaps my favourite idea for the end of the world. the Rapture has nothing on this.

I am already beginning work on a boat with which to cheat death, hell of Noah's ark style

name: slab64
text: A bucket that never fills, apparently.

name: setzkin
text: What makes you so sure that it is, in fact, a bucket rather than a conical opening into a vomit-filled chasm?

name: slab64
text: Word.

name: onepapertiger
text:
oh my god I can smell the thing.
Well played, player.

name: epicurus
text: Who is the whispering earth talking to, I wonder? This is head and shoulders the weirdest arc to date.

name: carlyle
text: To all whom have the ears to listen and the will to understand, the earth speaks it's dire warning of coming catastrophe

name: caduceo
text: A comment left by caduceo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, straw, Zefiel, silver_lake, The_Prophet, igotnostrings, TapaidhNaomh, Overmedicated, Thorfinn, Mangtastic, Jesler729, tibcoolbreeze, aargh, mashisoyo, gothfae, twohundredninety, purplehaze, yellowcardigan, Spenham, unalone, equinn2006, Tagrineth, Andrew_, electricjelly, meowmix, Vee, Lumus, luckypyjamas, earendil, mugi, Hyetal, nutmeg, MrPoopytime, captneko, scraggg, Merkin579, nphares, mattylite, drunkenimp, stormagnet, bilingualmonkey, Mastronaut, projectiles, Archon_Divinus, dr_sexlove)

name: odei
text:
You're asking things to make sense in a comic about anthropomorphic animals living hidden in human society where they have a large underground city and occasionally travel to the afterlife and back.

Perhaps there is some deeper meaning here or perhaps it's just a story. Whichever it is, I find the fact that there's an old man that constantly vomits fairly amusing, so there's your basic humour. If Onstad is in fact trying to create some surrealist art here then I don't have a problem with it, or the fact that he's doing it in a webcomic. I don't see why you must expect artists working with this medium to keep it simple, especially when Onstad himself has gone to such great lengths to turn his webcomic into something original, gripping, and amusing and nothing short of a masterpiece in some places.

name: nutmeg
text:
i thought of this arc as a parody of surrealism, and enjoyed it a ridiculous amount.
i loved Eraserhead, and i really liked that backwards-dancing midget from Twin Peaks. Onstad obviously appreciates this kind of thing as well and he was just paying homage to a subject that he has an interest in.
Back off caduceo and let a dogg do his thing. it's not your comic strip.

name: achilleselbow
text:
Yea, I'm gonna go with the parody angle too, which is the same thing I thought about the Cartilage Head arc. I agree with the general sentiment that webcomics should be funny, but to people who are familiar with surrealism and magical realism, seeing such references in a webcomic about cats is indeed funny. I had much more of a problem finding anything funny about The Great Outdoor Fight, which seemed to be just a not-quite-ironic homage/parody to bad 80's action movies of the same sort that South Park has done to the point of overkill.

I do think it's a bit ridiculous to make some kind of grandiose artistic claims for this. At the risk of elitism, I'm just going to say that discussing this on the level of serious art is a stretch. I doubt we'll see Onstad's work in MOMA any time soon.

name: johnnyrocker
text: It's not surrealism. It's Magical Realism.

name: kazad
text: What's wrong with non sense?

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Yeah, when is David Lynch going to get back to writing the classic achewood strips we all know and love?

name: choosebro
text:
Caduceo: The Dog who didn't value art.

(Refer to the alt text.)

name: mugi
text:
Whoa.


Whoa.

name: boredom_man
text: His art criticism is a dog's art criticism.

name: carbonation
text: The dog who valued art does not appear in this strip courtesy of Steve Martin.

name: soticoto
text:
And I thought Caduceo was simply being a douche before because photography doesn't really qualify as art... as I'd said... pffft.
Figures he'd be hating on the strip itself instead.

Idiot dog.

But still.... aside from clever references to the alt text, thus don't really have much to do with art.

name: scraggg
text: Tons of things make no sense whatsoever, and a lot of artists have chosen to convey that fun little bit of life in ways like this. That's the point, I guess.

name: tangles
text: you are obviously NOT the dog who appreciates art

name: tangles
text: wah! why do i look at archive strips expecting myself to have something new to add?

name: stuart
text: Ekil sdnuos eciov ym tahw si sihT

name: tbtabby
text: Thank you, Zatanna.

name: i_love_kate
text: Thank you , nerd.

name: snowman
text: Let's rock!

name: honesttom
text: "It's not going to be okay this time..." I actually use this phrase on a semi-regular basis. I don't know an old man who is constantly vomiting, but I have a friend who's been going at it for a while.

name: pitseleh
text: The whispering earth seems very ominous.

name: 7th_shot
text: A lot of Achewood makes me stop and think, or at least stop and appreciate, but I think the earth whispering "It's not going to be okay this time" is the only thing that's really unsettled me. Couldn't say why.

name: tangles
text: ruined my acid trip, for sure

name: 7th_shot
text: Gonna have to do a semi-retract on this one. The earth in this strip and the time Keith Moon's head went all crazy in a jar are equally upsetting concepts.

name: dartigen
text: Agree, and also the Cartilage Head strips. Look I know they were great but Cartilage Head just disturbs me on a level that nothing else can. (Keith Moon's head was mildly disturbing, but still funny because it seemed so harmless. The earth in this strip is...unsettling, but nothing I have read of Achewood so far has disturbed me as much as Cartilage Head.)

name: ninjaein
text: This arc is by far one of my favorites throughout the archives.  It is only topped by the Great Outdoors Fight.

name: gormster
text: Butters and Ray look like the things from the video for Hearts a Mess .

name: hooves
text: this strip could easily have been by edward gorey.

name: diggidy
text:
Do you think it's the good kind of vomiting, where you're like "Yes, this is good. This will make things better." or the bad kind where you're like "Oh my god, this needs to stop."?
Because I think I could handle the eternal good kind.

name: varnish
text: I believe that the whispering earth has the answer to this question.

name: lunchbox
text: For some reason, my mind keeps wandering back to Dante's Inferno whenever I read this strip. Must be the talking ground.

name: orvel
text: That whispering earth is from Return to Oz !

name: mr_lostman28
text:
dude... that movie scared the living crap out of 9 year old me. All crazy imp things on skates coming to get me in my nightmares.
all scree, scree, scree

name: puguglypress
text: Jeeeesus.

name: theguitarhero
text: The whispering earth is whispering because it is being raped? I think that is what Chris is saying here.

name: liithe
text: Maybe, I missed it, but I'm surprised that nobody noticed this: Mr. Permapuke has a wig, a shirt that matches Teodor's pants, and a sword. I think I imples that this "very old" man has been puking for centuries. This is the first strip in which I have noticed the little things.

name: liithe
text: Oops. One comma too many.

name: carlyle
text: What'd the man do? Piss off some wizard who cursed him?

name: dusty
text: The first thing that came to mind for me was that he might have been dueling a wizard as well.

name: westerberg
text: Holy shit, this strip scares the crap outta me.

name: quinlaenar
text: Everyone assumes the very old man who is permanently vomiting is wearing a wig. What happens if his hair just grows like that and you all are RACIST for assuming that just because a dude has a sword, his white, wiglike hair is a white powdered wig?
